intro: Ronabea emetica, commonly known as the emetic ronabea, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many toxic and ornamental plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically opposite and ovate, with a smooth surface. The plant contains various alkaloids, some of which are known to have emetic properties.
